author: The Telegraph
title: Glayva Edinburgh city break: terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK Mainland only, aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Whyte and Mackay Ltd (“Whyte and Mackay”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/glayva and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. The first 10,000 entrants to this prize draw will each receive an e-voucher for £3 off the price of a 50cl bottle of Glayva whisky liqueur, redeemable before January 31, 2016. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. One 1st Prize winner, five 2nd Prize winners and 10 3rd Prize winners will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a sae to Glayva Prize Draw Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, December 27, 2015 . 6. The winners will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. The prizes are as follow: 1st Prize One winning entrant will win a two-night short break for two in Edinburgh. The prize package comprises: • Two nights accommodation for two in the 4-star Malmaison Hotel based on two people sharing a twin or double room on a bed and breakfast basis; • Return rail or air travel allowance up to a maximum of £200 per person; • One £250 voucher to spend at The Kitchin, Leith; • £300 total spending money; and • One 50cl bottle of Glayva whisky liqueur. 2nd Prize Five winning entrants wil each win the following prize package: • One £150 voucher to spend at The Kitchin, Leith; and • One bottle of Glayva whisky liqueur. 3rd Prize 10 winning entrants will each win: • One bottle of Glayva whisky liqueur. 9. Where applicable, each winner must take their prize as one package. 10. The 1st Prize does not include arranged travel, travel insurance, transfers, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs, other than where mentioned. 11. The 2nd Prize does not include travel, accommodation, personal expenditure or incidental costs. 12. The 1st Prize and 2nd Prize must be taken before December 31, 2016. Availability will be limited during peak periods such as Christmas and New Year, Easter, school and bank holidays and during the Edinburgh Festival. 13. The prizes are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 14. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and Whyte and Mackay. 15. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 16. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prizes is the responsibility of Whyte and Mackay. 18. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. telegraph.co.uk
